intro: Seseli elbursense, commonly known as Elburz seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Elburz mountain range in Iran. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Seseli elbursense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its region.
